techmeme.title: Docs and sources: Amazon has discontinued a secretive effort to develop an at-home fertility tracker, which was part of its moonshot incubator Grand Challenge (Annie Palmer/CNBC)
AMD says it will lay off approximately 4% of its global staff; the company had 26,000 employees at the end of last year, according to an SEC filing (Kif Leswing/CNBC)
Sources: Meta plans to launch ads on Threads in early 2025; Meta's public statements imply any ad rollout for Threads next year will be slow (The Information)
CoreWeave closed a $650M secondary share sale led by Jane Street, Magnetar, Fidelity Management, and Macquarie Capital, a source says at a $23B valuation (Krystal Hu/Reuters)
South Korea arrests 215 people on suspicion of stealing $228M in crypto, the country's biggest crypto investment scam with 28 types of tokens sold to 15K people (Cynthia Kim/Reuters)
